meanings.def: the direction that is on your left when you watch the sun rise; one of the four main points of the compass
examples: Which way is north?
cold winds coming from the north
to the north (of…) Mount Kenya is to the north of (= further north than) Nairobi.
views of distant mountains to north and south

meanings.def: the northern part of a country, a region or the world
examples: birds migrating from the north
in the north Houses are less expensive in the North (= of England) than in the South.
They wanted to escape the cold of the north.
The main road ran across the north of the island.
There's been a severe earthquake in the north of the country.
Edinburgh was called the Athens of the North.

meanings.def: the north-east states of the US which fought against the South in the American Civil War
examples: Some delegates from Virginia voted to join the North.

meanings.def: the richer and more developed countries of the world, especially in Europe and North America
examples: The North refused to commit itself to safeguarding species diversity.
North London
the north bank of the river
the north end/side of the building
We ended up on the rugged north coast of California.
Enter the cathedral through the north door.

meanings.def: a north wind blows from the north
examples: A cold north wind blew in from the sea.
The house faces north.
The train was heading north to Paris.

meanings.def: nearer to the north than something
examples: They live ten miles north of Boston.
The estimated value is north of $5.4 billion.
The shares had already been trading north of £30.
temperatures north of 35°C

meanings.def: to or in the north of a country, especially England
examples: They've gone to live up north.

idioms.def: to or in the north of a country, especially England
examples: They've gone to live up north.
